alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lewis; Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 02 at 9:06PM EST until February 02 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Buffalo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Jefferson County in central New York... Lewis County in central New York... Oswego County in central New York... * Until 1000 PM EST. * At 905 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Fowler to 8 miles west of Oswego, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 81 between exits 32 and 49. Locations impacted include... Watertown, Oswego, Fulton, Fort Drum, Sandy Island Beach State Park, Stony Point, Carthage, Lowville, Pulaski and West Carthage. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
